intro: Hypsipodes subcordatus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed water plant, is a species of aquatic plant characterized by its slender, ribbon-like leaves that float on the water surface. It is native to freshwater habitats in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Southeast Asia. The plant has a branching root system that helps stabilize it in shallow water environments. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically greenish-white and appear in clusters. Hypsipodes subcordatus plays a role in providing habitat and oxygenation in aquatic ecosystems.
